FuncDef:
The ip userlog access export version command configures the version of packets used to send user login and logout logs.
The undo ip userlog access export version command cancels the configurations.
By default, the version of packets used to send user login and logout logs is 0.
CLIs: undo ip userlog access export version

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the version of packets used to send user login and logout logs.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 2.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
userlog access export version command to configure the version of packets used to send user login and logout logs. Currently, versions 1 and 2 are supported. They differ in VLAN/PVC formats in the packets (The current version does not allow packets to carry PVC information):
Version 1: 2-byte common VLAN ID or 2-byte PVC numberVersion 2: 2-byte stack VLAN ID (the value is 0 if there is no stack VLAN) and 2-byte common VLAN ID, or a 2-byte VPI and 2-byte VCI
Choose a version of packets in accordance with the VLAN tags carried in user login packets.
Version 1: applies to the scenario in which user login packets carry a single-layer VLAN tag.Version 2: applies to the scenario in which user login packets carry or partially carry double-layer VLAN tags.
If user login packets carry double-layer VLAN tags and version 1 is configured, only the outer VLAN tag is encapsulated into the packets.

Follow-up Procedure
Enable the generation of user login and logout logs.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
